An **air elemental**, E, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is an [unsolid](/wiki/Unsolid "Unsolid"), [whirly](/wiki/Whirly "Whirly") [elemental](/wiki/Elemental "Elemental") that is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong") and capable of [flight](/wiki/Flight "Flight").

An air elemental has a single [engulfing](/wiki/Engulf "Engulf") attack, and possesses [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") and [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 As a polymorph form](#As_a_polymorph_form)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Messages](#Messages)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.3 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [5.4 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Randomly generated air elementals may be [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful") towards [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral") characters. Air elementals generated on the [Plane of Air](/wiki/Plane_of_Air "Plane of Air") will have three times as many hit points.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

In addition to random generation, an air elemental may be generated as a [minion](/wiki/Minion "Minion") of a neutral [god](/wiki/God "God").

Air elementals appear among the random E that are part of the first quest class for [Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk") and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Monk quest](/wiki/Monk_quest "Monk quest"). They also appear among the the random E that are part of the second quest class for [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai") and make up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Samurai quest](/wiki/Samurai_quest "Samurai quest").

Eleven hostile air elementals are generated on the Plane of Air at level creation.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

Air elementals are not a valid target for [genocide](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide"). An air elemental [does not leave a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless") upon death.

## Strategy

The air elemental is the fastest monster that can be encountered in the game, and its 36 [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed") is the primary factor behind its deadliness: the amount of turns it can get while engulfing you and pummeling you with debris causes damage to pile up, even against fast and well-armored characters. Additionally, the damage is non-elemental, making it harder to defend against; [half physical damage](/wiki/Half_physical_damage "Half physical damage") and high [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") can blunt the damage dealt.

[Warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning") is a good property for trying to spot approaching hostile air elementals, since they are [mindless](/wiki/Mindless "Mindless") and cannot be detected by [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy"). Wands, spells and [tools](/wiki/Tool "Tool") that scare monsters can give you a significant edge against an air elemental, making it easier to weaken or kill them with other forms of magic and [ranged attacks](/wiki/Ranged_attack "Ranged attack") - be mindful of an air elemental's 30 [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)"), which gives it a significant chance of resistance.

To avoid being engulfed in the first place, a polyform that is [huge](/wiki/Huge "Huge") or larger can reliably prevent an air elemental from engulfing you. You can use a [wand of teleportation](/wiki/Wand_of_teleportation "Wand of teleportation") to send an approaching air elemental elsewhere, and a [wand](/wiki/Wand_of_sleep "Wand of sleep") or [spell of sleep](/wiki/Spell_of_sleep "Spell of sleep") can also immobilize it and give you valuable turns to either escape the monster or bring it down. A source of [conflict](/wiki/Conflict "Conflict") can keep the air elemental occupied fighting other monsters, allowing you to escape or defeat it as necessary.

If you are engulfed by an air elemental, you can escape using tools such as a [bugle](/wiki/Bugle "Bugle") to scare it into releasing you; the [knock](/wiki/Spellbook_of_knock "Spellbook of knock") and [slow monster](/wiki/Spellbook_of_slow_monster "Spellbook of slow monster") spells (or their equivalents in the [opening](/wiki/Wand_of_opening "Wand of opening") and [slow monster](/wiki/Wand_of_slow_monster "Wand of slow monster") wands) can also force the air elemental to expel you - in either case, their speed may allow them to get another chance at engulfing you. [Teleportation](/wiki/Teleportation "Teleportation") is a fairly reliable means of escaping an air elemental, either by zapping it with a wand of teleportation on a [non-teleport level](/wiki/Non-teleport_level "Non-teleport level"), or else teleporting yourself on any other level. If all else fails in any event, you can attempt to tame the air elemental (e.g., with a [scroll of taming](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming")), and a [wand](/wiki/Wand_of_death "Wand of death") or [finger of death](/wiki/Finger_of_death "Finger of death") will kill it instantly.

### As a polymorph form

Air elementals are sometimes used as a polyself form for traveling purposes, due to their high speed and flight. In terms of combat, their base AC of 2 is unimpressive, they cannot wear armor and the engulfing attack falls short as the sole source of damage when dealing with large monsters, such as the expected [giants](/wiki/Giant_\(monster_attribute\) "Giant (monster attribute)") and [dragons](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon"). The polyform is also [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind") and lacks [hands](/wiki/Hand "Hand") to adjust worn [rings](/wiki/Ring "Ring") or open containers, among other actions - a [wand of probing](/wiki/Wand_of_probing "Wand of probing") can reveal the identity of items you pick up while moving, as well as wearing the [Eyes of the Overworld](/wiki/Eyes_of_the_Overworld "Eyes of the Overworld").

## History

The air elemental first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"). From this version to [NetHack 3.3.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.1 "NetHack 3.3.1"), including some variants based on those versions, the air elemental's pummel attack dealt twice as much damage due to changes in the speed system.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5) This is fixed in [NetHack 3.4.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.0 "NetHack 3.4.0") via [commit 06b7862](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/06b7862).

## Messages

- You are pummeled with debris!

  You are being attacked by an air elemental that has you engulfed.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), at least one air elemental is generated within the Cloud Bank of the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest") at level creation, with a 3⁄5 chance of a second one being placed nearby.

Air elementals appear among the random E that are part of the first quest class for [Flame Mages](/wiki/Flame_Mage "Flame Mage") and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Flame Mage quest](/wiki/Flame_Mage_quest "Flame Mage quest").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), monster generation on the Air Temple level of the [Chaos Temple Quest](/wiki/Chaos_Temple_Quest "Chaos Temple Quest") has a 1⁄8 chance of creating an air elemental.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), a hostile air elemental is generated on the [Plane of Ice](/wiki/Plane_of_Ice "Plane of Ice") at level creation.

### SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") adds the [greater air elemental](/index.php?title=Greater_air_elemental\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Greater air elemental (page does not exist)"), though air elementals cannot grow up into them.

The Gnome King's Apiary variant of [Mines' End](/wiki/Mines%27_End "Mines' End") has a hidden 2x2 square area in the west end, where four hostile air elementals and a [wand of death](/wiki/Wand_of_death "Wand of death") are generated at level creation.

The [Electric Mage](/wiki/Electric_Mage "Electric Mage") [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact"), [The Harp of Lightning](/index.php?title=The_Harp_of_Lightning\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "The Harp of Lightning (page does not exist)"), can be [invoked](/wiki/Invoked "Invoked") to summon tame air elementals, and has a 3⁄4 chance of generating a standard one and a 1⁄4 chance of generating a greater one.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 39](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L39): *elementals and home planes*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1012](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L1012): *max HP for elementals on home planes*
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1825](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L1825): *max HP gain for elementals on home planes*
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [dat/endgame.des in NetHack 3.6.7, line 172](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/dat/endgame.des#L172)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [The Air Elemental FAQ - steelypips.org](http://www.steelypips.org/nethack/ae_faq.html)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Air elemental

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
E air elemental
Difficulty 10
Attacks Engulf 1d10
E air elemental
Difficulty 10
Attacks

Engulf 1d10

Base level 8
Base experience 126
Speed 36
Base AC 2
Base MR 30
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable No
Weight 0
Nutritional value 0
Size Huge
Resistances poison, petrification
Resistances conveyed None

An air elemental:

  • can fly.
  • has no eyes.
  • has no limbs.
  • has no head.
  • is mindless.
  • does not have a solid form.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is neither male nor female.
  • is strong.
  • never leaves a corpse.
Reference monst.c#line1364

An air elemental, E, is a type of monster that appears in NetHack. It is an unsolid, whirly elemental that is strong and capable of flight.

An air elemental has a single engulfing attack, and possesses poison resistance and stoning resistance.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
    • 2.1 As a polymorph form
  • 3 History
  • 4 Messages
  • 5 Variants
    • 5.1 SLASH'EM
    • 5.2 dNetHack
    • 5.3 SpliceHack
    • 5.4 SlashTHEM
  • 6 References

Generation

Randomly generated air elementals may be peaceful towards neutral characters. Air elementals generated on the Plane of Air will have three times as many hit points.[1][2][3]

In addition to random generation, an air elemental may be generated as a minion of a neutral god.

Air elementals appear among the random E that are part of the first quest class for Monks and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Monk quest. They also appear among the the random E that are part of the second quest class for Samurai and make up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Samurai quest.

Eleven hostile air elementals are generated on the Plane of Air at level creation.[4]

Air elementals are not a valid target for genocide. An air elemental does not leave a corpse upon death.

Strategy

The air elemental is the fastest monster that can be encountered in the game, and its 36 speed is the primary factor behind its deadliness: the amount of turns it can get while engulfing you and pummeling you with debris causes damage to pile up, even against fast and well-armored characters. Additionally, the damage is non-elemental, making it harder to defend against; half physical damage and high AC can blunt the damage dealt.

Warning is a good property for trying to spot approaching hostile air elementals, since they are mindless and cannot be detected by telepathy. Wands, spells and tools that scare monsters can give you a significant edge against an air elemental, making it easier to weaken or kill them with other forms of magic and ranged attacks - be mindful of an air elemental's 30 MR score, which gives it a significant chance of resistance.

To avoid being engulfed in the first place, a polyform that is huge or larger can reliably prevent an air elemental from engulfing you. You can use a wand of teleportation to send an approaching air elemental elsewhere, and a wand or spell of sleep can also immobilize it and give you valuable turns to either escape the monster or bring it down. A source of conflict can keep the air elemental occupied fighting other monsters, allowing you to escape or defeat it as necessary.

If you are engulfed by an air elemental, you can escape using tools such as a bugle to scare it into releasing you; the knock and slow monster spells (or their equivalents in the opening and slow monster wands) can also force the air elemental to expel you - in either case, their speed may allow them to get another chance at engulfing you. Teleportation is a fairly reliable means of escaping an air elemental, either by zapping it with a wand of teleportation on a non-teleport level, or else teleporting yourself on any other level. If all else fails in any event, you can attempt to tame the air elemental (e.g., with a scroll of taming), and a wand or finger of death will kill it instantly.

As a polymorph form

Air elementals are sometimes used as a polyself form for traveling purposes, due to their high speed and flight. In terms of combat, their base AC of 2 is unimpressive, they cannot wear armor and the engulfing attack falls short as the sole source of damage when dealing with large monsters, such as the expected giants and dragons. The polyform is also blind and lacks hands to adjust worn rings or open containers, among other actions - a wand of probing can reveal the identity of items you pick up while moving, as well as wearing the Eyes of the Overworld.

History

The air elemental first appears in NetHack 3.0.0. From this version to NetHack 3.3.1, including some variants based on those versions, the air elemental's pummel attack dealt twice as much damage due to changes in the speed system.[5] This is fixed in NetHack 3.4.0 via commit 06b7862.

Messages

You are pummeled with debris!
You are being attacked by an air elemental that has you engulfed.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, at least one air elemental is generated within the Cloud Bank of the Lawful Quest at level creation, with a 3⁄5 chance of a second one being placed nearby.

Air elementals appear among the random E that are part of the first quest class for Flame Mages and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Flame Mage quest.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, monster generation on the Air Temple level of the Chaos Temple Quest has a 1⁄8 chance of creating an air elemental.

SpliceHack

In SpliceHack, a hostile air elemental is generated on the Plane of Ice at level creation.

SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, SlashTHEM adds the greater air elemental, though air elementals cannot grow up into them.

The Gnome King's Apiary variant of Mines' End has a hidden 2x2 square area in the west end, where four hostile air elementals and a wand of death are generated at level creation.

The Electric Mage quest artifact, The Harp of Lightning, can be invoked to summon tame air elementals, and has a 3⁄4 chance of generating a standard one and a 1⁄4 chance of generating a greater one.

References

  1. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 39: elementals and home planes
  2. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1012: max HP for elementals on home planes
  3. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1825: max HP gain for elementals on home planes
  4. ↑ dat/endgame.des in NetHack 3.6.7, line 172
  5. ↑ The Air Elemental FAQ - steelypips.org

An '''air elemental''', {{monsym|air elemental}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is an [[unsolid]], [[whirly]] [[elemental]] that is [[strong]] and capable of [[flight]].

An air elemental has a single [[engulf]]ing attack, and possesses [[poison resistance]] and [[stoning resistance]].

==Generation==
Randomly generated air elementals may be [[peaceful]] towards [[neutral]] characters. Air elementals generated on the [[Plane of Air]] will have three times as many hit points.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|39|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=elementals and home planes}}{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|1012|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=max HP for elementals on home planes}}{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|1825|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=max HP gain for elementals on home planes}}

In addition to random generation, an air elemental may be generated as a [[minion]] of a neutral [[god]].

Air elementals appear among the random {{white|E}} that are part of the first quest class for [[Monk]]s and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Monk quest]]. They also appear among the the random {{white|E}} that are part of the second quest class for [[Samurai]] and make up {{frac|6|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Samurai quest]].

Eleven hostile air elementals are generated on the Plane of Air at level creation.{{refsrc|dat/endgame.des|172|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

Air elementals are not a valid target for [[genocide]]. An air elemental [[Corpseless|does not leave a corpse]] upon death.

==Strategy==
The air elemental is the fastest monster that can be encountered in the game, and its 36 [[speed]] is the primary factor behind its deadliness: the amount of turns it can get while engulfing you and pummeling you with debris causes damage to pile up, even against fast and well-armored characters. Additionally, the damage is non-elemental, making it harder to defend against; [[half physical damage]] and high [[AC]] can blunt the damage dealt.

[[Warning]] is a good property for trying to spot approaching hostile air elementals, since they are [[mindless]] and cannot be detected by [[telepathy]]. Wands, spells and [[tool]]s that scare monsters can give you a significant edge against an air elemental, making it easier to weaken or kill them with other forms of magic and [[ranged attack]]s - be mindful of an air elemental's 30 [[Magic resistance (monster)|MR score]], which gives it a significant chance of resistance.

To avoid being engulfed in the first place, a polyform that is [[huge]] or larger can reliably prevent an air elemental from engulfing you. You can use a [[wand of teleportation]] to send an approaching air elemental elsewhere, and a [[Wand of sleep|wand]] or [[spell of sleep]] can also immobilize it and give you valuable turns to either escape the monster or bring it down. A source of [[conflict]] can keep the air elemental occupied fighting other monsters, allowing you to escape or defeat it as necessary. 

If you are engulfed by an air elemental, you can escape using tools such as a [[bugle]] to scare it into releasing you; the {{spell of|knock|and=1|slow monster}} spells (or their equivalents in the {{wand of|opening|and=1|slow monster}} wands) can also force the air elemental to expel you - in either case, their speed may allow them to get another chance at engulfing you. [[Teleportation]] is a fairly reliable means of escaping an air elemental, either by zapping it with a wand of teleportation on a [[non-teleport level]], or else teleporting yourself on any other level. If all else fails in any event, you can attempt to tame the air elemental (e.g., with a [[scroll of taming]]), and a [[Wand of death|wand]] or [[finger of death]] will kill it instantly.

===As a polymorph form===
Air elementals are sometimes used as a polyself form for traveling purposes, due to their high speed and flight. In terms of combat, their base AC of 2 is unimpressive, they cannot wear armor and the engulfing attack falls short as the sole source of damage when dealing with large monsters, such as the expected [[Giant (monster attribute)|giants]] and [[dragon]]s. The polyform is also [[blind]] and lacks [[hand]]s to adjust worn [[ring]]s or open containers, among other actions - a [[wand of probing]] can reveal the identity of items you pick up while moving, as well as wearing the [[Eyes of the Overworld]].

==History==
The air elemental first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.0]]. From this version to [[NetHack 3.3.1]], including some variants based on those versions, the air elemental's pummel attack dealt twice as much damage due to changes in the speed system.<ref>[http://www.steelypips.org/nethack/ae_faq.html The Air Elemental FAQ - steelypips.org]</ref> This is fixed in [[NetHack 3.4.0]] via {{commit|06b7862|commit 06b7862}}.

==Messages==
{{message|You are pummeled with debris!|You are being attacked by an air elemental that has you engulfed.}}

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], at least one air elemental is generated within the Cloud Bank of the [[Lawful Quest]] at level creation, with a {{frac|3|5}} chance of a second one being placed nearby.

Air elementals appear among the random {{white|E}} that are part of the first quest class for [[Flame Mage]]s and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Flame Mage quest]].

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], monster generation on the Air Temple level of the [[Chaos Temple Quest]] has a {{frac|8}} chance of creating an air elemental.

===SpliceHack===
In [[SpliceHack]], a hostile air elemental is generated on the [[Plane of Ice]] at level creation.

===SlashTHEM===
In addition to SLASH'EM details, [[SlashTHEM]] adds the [[greater air elemental]], though air elementals cannot grow up into them.

The Gnome King's Apiary variant of [[Mines' End]] has a hidden 2x2 square area in the west end, where four hostile air elementals and a [[wand of death]] are generated at level creation.

The [[Electric Mage]] [[quest artifact]], [[The Harp of Lightning]], can be [[invoked]] to summon tame air elementals, and has a {{frac|3|4}} chance of generating a standard one and a {{frac|4}} chance of generating a greater one.
